text: Psalm 31
Yahweh Is a Fortress
For the \add music\add* director. A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 31 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
In you, O Yahweh, I have taken refuge.
Let me not be put to shame ever.
Deliver me by your righteousness.
Incline your ear to me.
Quickly deliver me.
Become my rock of refuge,
⸤a fortified keep⸥\f + \fr 31:2 \ft Literally “a house of strongholds” \f* to save me.
For you \add are\add* my rock and my fortress.
So, for the sake of your name,
lead me and guide me.
Bring me out of \add the\add* net that they have secretly set for me,
for you \add are\add* my refuge.
Into your hand I commit my spirit.
You have redeemed me, O Yahweh, faithful God.\f + \fr 31:5 \ft Or “God of truth” \f*
I hate those devoted to useless idols,
but I trust Yahweh.
I will exult and rejoice in your loyal love.
Because you have seen my misery,
you know the distresses of my life.\f + \fr 31:7 \ft Or “soul” \f*
And you have not delivered me
into \add the\add* hand of \add the\add* enemy.
You have set my feet in a broad place.
Be gracious \add to\add* me, O Yahweh,
because I have distress.
My eye wastes away because of vexation,
\add along with\add* my soul and my ⸤body⸥.\f + \fr 31:9 \ft Literally “belly” \f*
For my life is at an end with sorrow,
and my years with sighing.
My strength stumbles because of my iniquity,
and my bones waste away.
Because of all my adversaries I have become a disgrace,
especially to my neighbors,
and a dread to my acquaintances.
\add Those who\add* see me in the street flee from me.
I have become forgotten like \add one\add* dead, out of ⸤mind⸥.\f + \fr 31:12 \ft Literally “heart” \f*
I am like a destroyed vessel.
For I hear \add the\add* rumor of many,
“Terror on every side!”
When conspiring together against me,
they have plotted to take my life.
But as for me, I trust you, O Yahweh.
I say, “You \add are\add* my God.”
My times\f + \fr 31:15 \ft Or “destiny” \f* \add are\add* in your hand.
Deliver me from the hand of my enemies
and from \add those who\add* pursue me.
Shine your face upon your servant.
Save me by your loyal love.
O Yahweh, let me not be put to shame, for I call on you.
Let the wicked be put to shame.
Let them \add go\add* silently\f + \fr 31:17 \ft Or “let them \fq with \ft wailing \fq enter \ft ” \f* to Sheol.
Let lying lips be dumb,
that speak against \add the\add* righteous\f + \fr 31:18 \ft Or “the innocent one” \f* unrestrained
with arrogance and contempt.
How abundant \add is\add* your goodness
that you have stored up for \add those who\add* fear you,
that you perform for those who take refuge in you
before \add the\add* children of humankind.
You will hide them in the protection of your presence
from \add the\add* plots of man.
You will hide them in a shelter from \add the\add* strife of tongues.
Blessed \add is\add* Yahweh,
because he has worked marvelously his loyal love to me
in a besieged city.
As for me, I said in my alarm,
“I am cut off from before your eyes.”
However you heard the voice of my supplications
when I cried to you for help.
Love Yahweh, all you his faithful ones.
Yahweh preserves \add the\add* faithful
but repays abundantly \add the\add* one who acts arrogantly.
Be strong and let your\f + \fr 31:24 \ft Plural \f* heart show strength,
all \add you\add* who wait for Yahweh.
